In the JST, verse 5 reads, "The Lord God hath appointed mine ears" rather than "opened mine ear."

The subject still seems to be the servant Israel. The persecution of the Latter-day Saints, particularly in the days of Joseph Smith, is very similar to the events in these verses. The passage may also describe the persecution of the Savior as he was condemned. According to tradition, Isaiah also faced persecutors, eventually being sawn asunder with a wooden saw.
